@canagprm

no, cropped means removing parts of the image, this almost always (in video) alters the aspect ratio. 

'imax' resolution/aspect ratio has a longer vertical axis than the commonly used 2.39:1.

basically, when you view an 'imax' version of a movie, the black bars that appear on your television above and below the movie (to maintain the intended widescreen aspect ratio) will sometimes disappear and be filled with more image. It's during the scenes that were filmed in 'imax' format that this will occur. 

if the description is accurate and this rip is of the typical res of 1280x544 (actually 2.35:1 aspect rato but pretty much 2.39:1), then it isn't a rip of the imax version. any rips of the imax version are going to be 1280x720. 

being that the offical release date of the blu-ray is the 17th of April, we might not be lucky enough to have a retail imax rip before then. i saw it at the cinemas so i can happily wait till then for the imax version as it makes a nice bit of difference on my 60". 

further reading:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cropping_(image)
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IMAX
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Display_resolution
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aspect_ratio_(image)

notnowplz have you ever downloaded a movie before? There are literally thousands of "real" 720p bluray/5.1 rips on this site at 4.38gb, many are even smaller. Read the description, it says X264 - that's a codec which compresses the file to whatever size required. In this case 4.38gb which commonly used because it fits on a DVD whilst still maintaining a good level of quality.

This is missing the top, bottom, around 88, horizontal lines in the IMAX scenes. Video resolution has to be 1280 x 720 like how it was in the 720p rips of The Dark Knight (also partially shot in IMAX).

@DownTYU - Thanks for the update. After some Googling, it seems that Brad Bird tweeted he "might" consider an IMAX version on blu-ray if there's enough demand from the fans. In other words, there almost certainly WILL be an IMAX version, but we'll have to wait and we don't know for how long. For those of us who didn't see the movie at the theater, we're now faced with the choice of watching the blu-ray as it is today, or waiting an unspecified length of time for an unconfirmed IMAX version. XXX FOR ALL THOSE COMPLAINING D/L SPEED 

(long story short)--In your torrent client don't "force start" your torrent. (if you have that option).

(long version)
being a novice myself "googled" info on how to speed up upload/downloads.   I like to seed more than I download and in my prefs. I have my option set to upload more than I download.

So when I goto download I just force start.  

When I got to the torrent speed info stuff when I stopped forcing, my speeds increased dramatically. 

Also, I'm not really complaining about anyone but just wanted to share that tip.  So hopefully it can help some people.
